intro: Tithymalus braunii, commonly known as the Braun's tithymale, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is found in various parts of Europe. Its foliage consists of finely divided, aromatic leaves that emit a subtle scent when crushed. Tithymalus braunii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
